DOC.brief_summary: To test the hypothesis that there is no difference in change in HbA1C among men with type 2-diabetes after an exercise intervention with strength versus endurance training.
DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Exercise Training Among Men With Type 2-diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: Exercise training is well documented as part of effective treatment for type 2-diabetes patients. Endurance training has been suggested as the most suitable form of exercise. There are reasons to believe that strength training also has a positive effect. However, comparisons of endurance training and strength training regimes are limited. Therefore we randomized 26 men with type 2-diabetes to either an endurance training group or a strength training group. Both groups exercised three sessions per week for three months. The training was supervised.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed with type 2diabetes Male, 3571 years Managing their diabetes through a lifestyle and/or the drug metformin only Able to participate in either of the exercise groups Symptomatic cardiovascular disease Uncontrolled hypertension Physical or cognitive disabilities that will interfere with participating in the exercise regimes. Trained consistently during the last six months.
